Installation

In order to build and install the package you will need the following packages:

  • The CMake build system. At least version 2.8
  • Boost C++ libraries. Version 1.36 or greater.
  • A working C/C++ compiler. At this time only gcc has been tested but other compilers should work. In the case of gcc please make sure that is at least version 4.2

For the following instructions it is assumed that the directory /path/to/cprel contains the sorce distribution of this project.

Building instructions:

  • Open a terminal and create a directory to for the object files: 
       mkdir /path/to/build-cprel
   cd /path/to/build-cprel
  • Configure and build: 
       cmake /path/to/cprel
   make && make install

If any dependency is missing the configuration process will detect and inform you about that. The building process can be influenced by the definition of several variables when calling cmake. As an example consider the cmmand: 

   cmake -DCMAKE_PREFIX_PATH=/usr/local /path/to/cprel

That defines the variable CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH with the value /usr/local . this particular variable tell cmake to look for headers and libraries inside the /usr/local directory. This variable is specially useful if for instance, boost libraries and headers are located in /usr/local/include and /usr/local/lib.

The configuration script will search a gecode installation. For this project it is required that gecode is built with support for relation variables and this is why a normal installation will not work. If after running cmake you get a message that looks like: "No compatible version of gecode was found. ", proceed as follows:

  • Tell cmake to build gecode for you: 
       make BUILD_GECODE
   cmake /path/to/cprel
   make && make install
    The first statement will download the right version of gecode (svn is required) and will configure and install it. Please note that resulting gecode offers the same functionality as the one provided from the gecode web page. The only difference is that it is built with support for the new type of variables.

At this point you should have a working version of the constraint system. If something went wrong please DO NOT report the problems to the gecode mailing list but instead contact the authors of CPRel.
